title: Sampler, 1827
medium:
Medium: cotton embroidery on linen ground
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
inscribed:
Susan Nameck 1827
IFM   MM   SM  LM  CM
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. J. Insley Blair
1941, Museum of the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Gift of Mrs. J. Insely Blair in memory of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Sampler embroidered in red, black and blue on a white ground, with the alphabet and inscription Susanna Meck 1827 at the top, and many small detached motifs including animals, birds, urns of flowers, stars, etc. filling the field. With five sets of initials at the bottom: IFM  MM SM  LM CM

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1827.
1827. Medium: cotton embroidery on linen ground
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Gift of Mrs. J. Insely Blair in memory of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1941-98-93.
